column4: Ubuntu will not boot after an unclean shutdown. It says that I must run fsck manually and then asks for a root password. There is no password that I know of. HELP
boot to live cd and fsck your partitions
its the cd you installed with (or usb)
then you need the live cd desktop
well, you can but its not advised at all
boot to the live cd and read this:
boot to live cd desktop, unmount all partitions and run: sudo fsck -a /dev/sda5
if you mean your logon/sudo password you can boot to root recovery console and type: passwd <your username here>
if you are already logged in as the same user, you can simply run passwd to set your own password
are you logged in as alan?
if you type: whoami    does it say    alan
then just type: passwd     then, you can now set your password
is it asking for the current password?
your password is the one you type when you use sudo, or when synaptic asks you for a password
